title: Lake County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 60 meals/week (per local packet), max $50,000 annual sales (per local packet). No outdoor advertising; same-day prep/cook/serve rules.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Review Lake County’s MEHKO rules and confirm you qualify.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Lake County
- ☐ Menu + production plan (≤30/day, ≤60/week per county packet)
- ☐ Kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Read the county MEHKO page and Ordinance 3099; see Related Documents.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume within limits.

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get a Certified Food Protection Manager credential and any needed property approvals.

**Why it matters:** Certification and property permissions are required.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Property owner acknowledgment if renting
- ☐ City business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved course; obtain owner/landlord acknowledgment if renting.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days

**Ready when:** You have the certificate and approvals.
searchTerms: Lake County rental owner acknowledgment MEHKO
Lake County business license home kitchen

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather all documents before you apply.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay approval.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Plan Check Application (initial) 
- ☐ Property Owner Acknowledgement (if renting)
- ☐ CFPM certificate; ID & proof of residence

**Where/how:** Use the county forms listed on the MEHKO page.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are completed and saved as PDFs.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the SOP form covering menu, prep, storage, sanitation, delivery, water/sewage, waste, and safety.

**Why it matters:** Shows how you’ll operate safely at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Cooking/cooling/holding methods; thermometer
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

**Where/how:** Fill this SOP form and attach required items.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the Health Permit Application for a MEHKO.

**Why it matters:** This is the official request to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner/site information
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Plan Check approval (if required)

**Where/how:** Fill out and sign this application.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and matches your SOP.

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed forms and pay fees.

**Why it matters:** Processing starts after complete submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Plan Check Application (initial)
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Submit to Lake County Environmental Health, 922 Bevins Court, Lakeport, CA 95453. Phone (707) 263-1164.

**Cost & time:** Plan Check $135/hr (min 1 hr) · Annual Permit $269 · 10–20 minutes to submit

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate an in-home inspection.

**Why it matters:** Required before a permit is issued.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ Equipment functional

**Where/how:** County will schedule after application review.

**Cost & time:** Included in fees · ~1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You pass and any corrections are resolved.
searchTerms: Lake County home kitchen inspection checklist

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain your MEHKO permit and keep it available.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued after inspection approval.

**Cost & time:** $0 after fees

**Ready when:** Permit is issued and posted/available.
searchTerms: Lake County permit status Environmental Health

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and county limits; renew annually.

**Why it matters:** Protects customers and your permit.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Meal logs within limits
- ☐ Temp & cleaning records
- ☐ Renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Maintain records; update SOP if menu/volume changes.

**Cost & time:** Annual $269 · ongoing

**Ready when:** Records are kept and renewal is on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information for help.

**Why it matters:** Staff can answer county-specific questions.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone/email
- ☐ Office address and hours
- ☐ Website

**Where/how:** Lake County Environmental Health — 922 Bevins Court, Lakeport, CA 95453 · Phone (707) 263-1164 · Website: lakecountyca.gov/366/Microenterprise-Home-Kitchen-Operations-

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies

**Ready when:** You have what you need to proceed.
